document.docAuthor: Liu, Chun-Xiang, Heller, Klaus-Gerhard, Wang, Xue-Song, Yang, Zhen, Wu, Chao, Liu, Fei & Zhang, Tao
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomy of a katydid genus Mecopoda Serville (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae, Mecopodinae) from East Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomy of a katydid genus Mecopoda Serville (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae, Mecopodinae) from East Asia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Locusta ( Mecopoda ) niponensis Haan, 1843
. Temminck [Ed.] Verhandelingen over de Natuurlijke Geschiedenis der Nederlansche Overzeesche Bezittingen 19/20:188 (unspecified primary type , origin. Descript.; type locality: Japan ; type depository: unknown)

Mecopoda elongata Karny, 1921
. Philippine Journ. Science 18(5):612

Mecopoda niponensis Karny, 1924
. Treubia 5(1–3):159; Jin & Xia, 1994. Jour. Orth. Res. 3:28; Otte, 1997. Orthoptera Species File 7:101; Ichikawa. 2001. Tettigonia 3:79; Kim, T.-W. & J.I. Kim. 2001. Korean J. Entomol. 31(3):159; Shi, F.-M., L.H. Zhao & Xin Wang. 2013. Acta Zootaxonomica Sin. 38(4):739; Zhou, Z.-J., M. Yang, Y.-L. Chang & F.-M. Shi. 2014. Acta Entomol. Sin. 56(4):408–418; Han, L., H.-Y. Liu & F.-M. Shi. 2015. International Journal of Fauna and Biological Studies 2(1):19; Storozhenko, T.-W. Kim & Jeon. 2015. Monograph of Korean Orthoptera 33.

Mecopoda elongata variety niponensis Beier, 1966
. Orthopterorum Catalogus 9:299

Diagnosis . The species is distinguished from congeners by the short wide tegmen (see measurements in Tables 5–6).

Bioacoustics. Within a song unit, low-amplitude beginning and ending phases consists of repeated simple syllables, high-amplitude climax is complex and composed of several repeated subunits. One subunit consists of 3 variable-amplitude syllables ( Fig. 1 a–e).

M. niponensis
is is widely distributed in the subtropics of China (extending west-southward to Yunnan , northward to Henan ), eastward to Korea and Japan .
